intro: Arctostaphylos × bracteata, commonly known as the Sierra foothill manzanita, is a shrub native to California and parts of Nevada. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing protection against fire and drought. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
